description:
I primarily use 'Marker' to view markdown files written in 'Vim'.
I call 'Marker' from the command line (through a script)
Works really well with many useful settings.
I never knew I needed this app until I found it. The live preview makes writing and editing Markdown documents much easier. The app is also very intuitive and nice looking.
I really like it! And it is free as in freedom unlike Haroopad!
Works well and the live preview helps for easy editing. Best GTK markdown editor.
This App makes it really simple to create simple markdown documents. It has a nice simplistic user interface and is really stable.
Great app, works mostly like intended. Tough I can't seem to find the settings page

Simple UI, HTML preview, SUPPORTS LATEX (perfect for writing light equations), export to different formats, printing.

I use it for writing notes as well as chemistry homework (thanks to typesetting using LaTeX)

Great app. Just one another thing that I need from this is to get the preview "in line". Whenever I write, the preview is shown from the beginning of the doc. and not from the line where I'm currently writing.

Looks nice, has less markdown features than other apps, has a bit of help, but doesn't appear complete.
Save, reboot, start app. crashes. no window no anything.
An app that always crashes is pretty useless.
summary: Needs UX work and removal of critical bug

description:
can not hanle multiple open file
switching between view modes sometilel don't work

I have been using Ghostwriter for a while now which was quite buggy.
This editor renders the preview just fine and integrates well with the GNOME desktop. Keep up the good work!
summary: In my opinion the best Markdown editor

description: works great!! But if dark mode is enabled text is invisible. Disabling highlight current line is a workaround to fix that but it would be nice if more care is put into dark mode compatiblity

Would love to have table support.

Great Job!
I don't get why this app is not as famous as other, it really deserve your download.
Is Great, simplify work with markdown
No offense to the developers. Both are great, use what you prefer.
summary: I like it but Apostrophe is much better in my opinion

description: This software is pretty good!
It may be my favorite Markdown editor. But it doesn't comply with CommonMark. And the Flatpak version is a bit awkward to work with.
The markdown in the sidebar won't show up, even after restarting the app.

I was interested in this app after using Apostrophe as my markdown editor since it released. In my opinion, although it is a good markdown editor, Apostrophe still remains my main markdown editor.

This is for a few reasons.
1. The lack of a find-and-replace feature. Apostrophe includes this feature and I find it very useful if I have misspelt something throughout a document and need to fix it quickly.
2. It is still in some ways quite buggy: While changing the size of the editor/viewer, I noticed some annoying flickering. Although Apostrophe doesn't let you change the size of the editor and viewer against each other, this bug shows that the software is in some ways unfinished.
3. Strange colour theme behaviour: I have my gnome colour theme set to dark, and the editor seems to comply with this (to some extent), however the viewing window does not and is in a contrasting light mode. The line that you have selected in the editor is highlighted white, which makes it EXTREMELY difficult to see the white text that you are writing.
3. Lack of in-app colour themes: in Apostrophe, you are able to change the colour theme to white, cream, or dark. I like changing this between the day and night, and the lack of this feature is annoying.

Overall, this is a good markdown editor, however I think that Apostrophe is a better choice for now.

It's a simple markdown app with lovely preview and export options. The snap is more current that the flatpak. But I don't know if there's any difference between the two versions. I'm using the flatpak.
Nothing is displayed in preview.
Excellently laid out. It supports mermaid formatting and dual-window editing - just the features I needed for writing GitHub documentation!

The other 20% are: Broken on X11.
The right side preview does not work. Which makes it hard to rely on this tool if you happen to work on Wayland and X11 across different devices.
(Note: This is not an nvidia issue as it happens on an AMD and Intel GPUs using open drivers as well)

In der aktuellen Version funktioniert KaTeX nicht.
Leider ist auch keine Rechtschreibprüfung integriert :(
Supports spell checking in languages and even KaTex for math formula.
Once you memorized all the Markdown, KaTex, Plotting and Mairmaid commands it's a very fast and clean way to take notes in class for example.
echo en falta soporte para varias pestañas. Algo tipo gedit, sencillo pero muy útil para manejar varios documentos sin tener que guardar/cerrar uno para abrir otro. Que no estamos en 1992.
Muy bueno, le faltaría alguna cosita como el scroll simultáneo e igualar las pantallas por defecto, o recordar la posición de la ventana, pero en general un 9,5/10.
